entry.title: ODA CONFIRMS RABBIT HEMORRHAGIC DISEASE IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: April 17, 2025 10:00 a.m. On Wednesday, the Oregon Department of Agriculture confirmed Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease in domestic rabbits in a Douglas County rabbitry. An ODA release said the rabbit’s owner noted sudden rabbit deaths, reporting the symptoms to their veterinarian late last week. The veterinarian suspected RHDV and immediately reported it to ODA. entry.title: COUNTY BUILDING PERMITS DROP IN 2024

entry.title: OREGON’S UNEMPLOYMENT RATE WAS 4.6 PERCENT IN MARCH
entry.summary: April 17, 2025 3:30 a.m. Oregon’s unemployment rate was 4.6 percent in March and 4.5 percent in February, after rising gradually over the past year from 4.1 percent in March 2024. A State of Oregon Employment Department release said Oregon’s 4.6 percent unemployment rate was the highest since August 2021, when the rate was 4.7...

entry.title: Subway Reopens on Stewart Parkway in Roseburg
entry.summary: The Subway on Stewart Parkway in Roseburg has reopened under new ownership. Now operated by Utahsubs, the location features a drive-thru and is open daily from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. It joins their other stores in Myrtle Creek and Canyonville, with 10 to 12 employees staffing the shop.

entry.title: Roseburg Set for Hottest Day of 2025 So Far
entry.summary: Roseburg is expected to hit 83°F on Monday, making it the hottest day of 2025 so far. That’s nearly 20 degrees above normal for April. The previous high this year was 78°F. While not a record, it’s close - the hottest April 14th on record was 88°F, set back in 1947
